intro: Tristagma hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy tristagma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous structure and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, adding a delicate touch to its landscape. The hairy tristagma has small, ovate leaves and produces legumes as its fruit, which contain several seeds.
